net.smacke.jaydio.channel

Interface BufferedChannel<T extends Buffer>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Channel, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DirectIoByteChannel, MockByteChannel

    public interface BufferedChannel<T extends Buffer>
extends Channel
    Channel which supports positional reads and writes from/to a buffer to an underlying resource.
    Author:
    smacke

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getFD() 
      boolean isReadOnly() 
      int read(T dst, long position)
      Reads from this channel into the dst buffer from position.
      long size() 
      BufferedChannel<T> truncate(long fileLength)
      Truncates this file's length to fileLength.
      int write(T src, long position)
      Writes from the src buffer into this channel at position.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.nio.channels.Channel

        close, isOpen

    • Method Detail

      • write

        int write(T src,
        long position)
          throws IOException
        Writes from the src buffer into this channel at position.

        Parameters:
        src - The Buffer to write from
        position - The position within the file at which to start writing
        Returns:
        How many bytes were written from src into the file
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        int read(T dst,
       long position)
         throws IOException
        Reads from this channel into the dst buffer from position.

        Parameters:
        dst - The Buffer to read into
        position - The position within the file at which to start reading
        Returns:
        How many bytes were placed into dst
        Throws:
        IOException

      • size

        long size()
        Returns:
        The file size for this channel

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns:
        true if this channel is read only, false otherwise

      • truncate

        BufferedChannel<T> truncate(long fileLength)
                                           throws IOException
        Truncates this file's length to fileLength.

        Parameters:
        fileLength - The length to which to truncate
        Returns:
        This UnsafeByteAlignedChannel
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getFD

        int getFD()
        Returns:
        The file descriptor for this channel
